description: This file defines the Java class `JavaEventProducer`, responsible for broadcasting `JavaEvent` objects via multicast UDP. It includes methods to initialize multicast socket connections, register event listeners, marshal events into JSON, and send them over the network. The class collaborates with other event-related classes and interfaces within the project to facilitate event transmission and handling.

classes.name: JavaEventProducer
classes.description: A class for broadcasting JavaEvent objects over multicast UDP to registered listeners. Manages socket setup, event listener registration, and event serialization into JSON.

methods.name: JavaEventProducer
methods.description: Constructor that establishes multicast socket on local loopback interface and initializes group address and listener list.

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Closes the socket and releases associated resources.

methods.name: addEventAdapterListener
methods.description: Registers an inner process event listener to receive callbacks before broadcasting.

methods.name: removeEvenAdaptertListener
methods.description: Unregisters an inner process event listener.

methods.name: broadcastEvent
methods.description: Serializes the JavaEvent into JSON, registers internal listeners, and broadcasts it via multicast UDP.

methods.name: marshalEvent
methods.description: Converts a JavaEvent object into a JSON string and then into a byte array for transmission.
